comments:
I am using the mda tool kit plug-in for opening 3 .mdx files. This opens up the models correctly, but also throws all this error messages in the plug-in console window.

Here is the error log I am getting while I am opeing a model:
[Fatal Error] :-1:-1: Premature end of file.
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:63)
	at com.rational.rose.ea.platform.rainier.collaboration.interaction.ToolboxProviderHelper.getContentItemFor(Unknown Source)
	at com.rational.rose.ea.platform.rainier.collaboration.interaction.ToolboxProviderHelper.isOurToolItem(Unknown Source)
	at com.rational.rose.extension.providers.toolboxbundled.ToolboxProvider.DoesProvide(Unknown Source)
	at com.rational.rcsi.IRSToolboxUserJNI.IsSupported(Native Method)
	at com.rational.rcsi.IRSToolboxUserProxy.IsSupported(Unknown Source)
	at com.rational.startuppkg.toolbox.RSToolboxUser.IsSupported(RSToolboxUser.java:51)
	at com.rational.startuppkg.toolbox.ToolboxViewer.isItemSupported(ToolboxViewer.java:1554)
	at com.rational.startuppkg.toolbox.ToolboxViewer.checkForSupportedItems(ToolboxViewer.java:1518)
	at com.rational.startuppkg.toolbox.ToolboxViewer$3.run(ToolboxViewer.java:1432)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1999)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1402)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeImpl(Native Method)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeL(AccessibleObject.java:207)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)

This bug should be reported to IBM as it seems to involve some problems in rational rose.
